argumentText:
ARGUMENT
y z

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | #P_sssucid | |- A C_ suc A |
| 2 |  | #P_id | |- ( Tr A -> Tr A ) |
| 3 |  | #P_id | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) |
| 4 |  | #P_simpl | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. y ) |
| 5 | 3, 4 | #P_syl | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. y ) |
| 6 |  | #P_id | |- ( y e. A -> y e. A ) |
| 7 |  | #P_trel | |- ( Tr A -> ( ( z e. y /\ y e. A ) -> z e. A ) ) |
| 8 | 7 | #P_3impib | |- ( ( Tr A /\ z e. y /\ y e. A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 9 | 2, 5, 6, 8 | #P_syl3an | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y e. A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 10 |  | #P_ssel2 | |- ( ( A C_ suc A /\ z e. A ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 11 | 1, 9, 10 | #P_eel0321old | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y e. A ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 12 | 11 | #P_3expia | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) -> ( y e. A -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 13 |  | #P_id | |- ( y = A -> y = A ) |
| 14 |  | #P_eleq2 | |- ( y = A -> ( z e. y <-> z e. A ) ) |
| 15 | 14 | #P_biimpac | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y = A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 16 | 5, 13, 15 | #P_syl2an | |- ( ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y = A ) -> z e. A ) |
| 17 | 1, 16, 10 | #P_eel021old | |- ( ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) /\ y = A ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 18 | 17 | #P_ex | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( y = A -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 19 |  | #P_simpr | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> y e. suc A ) |
| 20 | 3, 19 | #P_syl | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> y e. suc A ) |
| 21 |  | #P_elsuci | |- ( y e. suc A -> ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ) |
| 22 | 20, 21 | #P_syl | |- ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ) |
| 23 |  | #P_jao | |- ( ( y e. A -> z e. suc A ) -> ( ( y = A -> z e. suc A ) -> ( ( y e. A \/ y = A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) ) |
| 24 | 23 | #P_3imp | |- ( ( ( y e. A -> z e. suc A ) /\ ( y = A -> z e. suc A ) /\ ( y e. A \/ y = A ) ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 25 | 12, 18, 22, 24 | #P_eel2122old | |- ( ( Tr A /\ ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) ) -> z e. suc A ) |
| 26 | 25 | #P_ex | |- ( Tr A -> ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 27 | 26 | #P_alrimivv | |- ( Tr A -> A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 28 |  | #P_dftr2 | |- ( Tr suc A <-> A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) ) |
| 29 | 28 | #P_biimpri | |- ( A. z A. y ( ( z e. y /\ y e. suc A ) -> z e. suc A ) -> Tr suc A ) |
| 30 | 27, 29 | #P_syl | |- ( Tr A -> Tr suc A ) |
| 31 | 30 | #P_iin1 | |- ( Tr A -> Tr suc A ) |
\
 The sucessor of a transitive class is transitive. ~ suctrALTcf , using conventional notation, was translated from virtual deduction form, ~ suctrALTcfVD , using a translation program.  (Contributed by Alan Sare, 13-Jun-2015.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
